content: I have recently been given write access to the GitHub repo for the dotnet C# library called NHapi which is a port of the java library hapi since Dwayne (author) doesnt have time to maintain it. However it uses the Hl7 normative access database to generate the C# classes. Who could I speak to about obtaining a copy of the databases legitimately for free so that I am able to support the NHapi project moving forward.
@James Agnew @Frank Oemig
Well, I maintain it, but permission must be obtained by HQ.

@Frank Oemig @Lloyd McKenzie
I have sent an email to hq yesterday regarding this, hopefully they will get back to me soon, once this happens do I need to speak with you? (Assuming they approve).
Yea, I can provide you with a download link to the newest version which is currently under preparation
@Frank Oemig do you know how long does HQ usually take to respond to emails?
It should not take too long. Certainly not days
This is not a standard question, and there is a legal aspect to it, the answer may take some time for that reason ;-)
@René Spronk thanks for the info.
@René Spronk I don't suppose you know the current status of the email?
@Jake Aitchison can you send me the email?
@Lynn Laakso sure is it lynn@HL7.org?
@Lynn Laakso ok forwarded the email.
@Lynn Laakso did you receive the email ok?

yes, and it has made the rounds through HQ for approval. Still working on the backend recordkeeping but @Frank Oemig can send you the latest db - or would you prefer Jake downloads it from the HL7 site?
@Lynn Laakso thanks for the response.
@Frank Oemig do u need me to creat some account on the Hl7 website?
